IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To assist ambulatory health care organizations improve the quality of care they provide through surveys and accreditation programs.
IRS990.MissionDescription: AAAHC assists ambulatory health care organizations improve the quality of care they provide to their patients. This is accomplished by setting standards, measuring performance, providing consultation and education, and ultimately by awarding accreditation to those organizations that are found to be in compliance with its standards. The Association services ambulatory health care organizations throughout the United States. The Association's primary source of revenue is survey fees earned from review of ambulatory health care organizations' operations.
IRS990.Description: The Association helps ambulatory health care organizations improve the quality of care they provide by setting standards, measuring performance, providing consultation and education and ultimately by awarding accreditation to those organizations that are found to be in compliance with its standards.

OtherAssets.Description: Due from affiliate (AAAHC Inst for Quality Improv-A 501(C)(3)ORG.)

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Fin 48 Footnote: The Association is exempt from federal income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and, therefore, has made no provision for federal income taxes in the accompanying financial statements. The tax exempt purpose of the Association and the nature in which it operates is described in the first paragraph of the Nature of Operations footnote (page 2 of 990). The association continues to operate in compliance with its tax exempt purpose and management's assessment is that there is no uncertain tax positions. The annual information and income tax returns filed with the federal and state governments are subject to examination for the statutory period.

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: National Foundation for Centers for Disease Control Inc

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Grants are approved by the Board of Directors and reported in the Board minutes and accounting records of the Organization.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Payment of health club dues offered to employees.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 4
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization's Bylaws were revised on April 18, 2010 and consist of the following changes: 1. The words "Executive Director" were replaced with "Executive Vice President". 2. Article IV. Members, Section 6 reads "Transfer. Membership in the corporation is not transferable or assignable, whether by operation of law or otherwise." 3. Article IX. Governing Council Section 5(f) reads "Carrying out the functions of the Board between meetings except those matters that, pursuant to applicable law or bylaws, requires a supermajority vote of the Board."

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Membership consists of other ambulatory healthcare organizations.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Each member organization sends one or two representatives to sit on the Board of AAAHC. The board members elect officers of the Board of Directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Member organizations are represented on the Board of Directors and therefore each member organization participates in decisions by the governing body through its board representatives.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 is reviewed and approved by the Executive Vice President and Senior Director of Finance who provide a copy to the Board of Directors prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Executive Vice President's compensation is determined through the Executive Committee of the AAAHC Board of Directors. In 2008, the Executive Committee of the AAAHC Board of Directors conducted a compensation review through Integrated Healthcare Strategies, an independent consulting firm focusing on executive total compensation and determine five job levels in which to slot the Executive Vice President and top management positions.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available upon request.
